response.title: Receptionist Secretary at XYZ Corp - Frankfurt
response.description:
Job Summary:

XYZ Corp, a leading firm in Frankfurt, is looking for a dynamic Receptionist Secretary to join our team. This role is instrumental in creating a welcoming and efficient environment for both our staff and visitors. The Receptionist Secretary will be the face of the company for all guests and will be responsible for the first impressions we make. The ideal candidate will have a friendly and easy going personality while also being very perceptive and disciplined. A customer-oriented approach is essential.

The goal is to provide top-notch administrative support and to contribute to the overall efficient operation of the organization.

Job Responsibilities:

- Greet visitors and direct them to the appropriate departments or individuals.
- Answer telephones and respond to inquiries via telephone or email.
- Book meeting rooms, manage conference schedules, and organize company events.
- Maintain a clean and organized reception area.
- Handle administrative requests and queries from senior managers.
- Organizing and maintaining files and records and updating them as necessary.
- Preparing outgoing mail and correspondence, including e-mail and faxes.

Qualifications:

- Proven work experience as a Receptionist, Front Office Representative or similar role.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and office management software.
- Excellent organizational skills.
- Strong communication and people skills.
- High School degree; additional certification in office management is a plus.

We offer a competitive salary package, a professional working environment, and opportunities for growth and advancement.

response.title: Executive Secretary - Senior Level (m/f/d) - Frankfurt
response.description:
Job Overview

A leading multinational company is seeking an experienced Executive Secretary to support senior executives in Frankfurt. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in facilitating the efficient operation of the organization by providing exceptional administrative support to executive team members.

Key Responsibilities
• Manage and maintain executives’ schedules and appointments, ensuring effective use of their time.
• Prepare and edit correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents on behalf of executives.
• File and retrieve corporate documents, records, and reports.
• Arrange and coordinate meetings and events, including booking venues and organizing hospitality.
• Record, transcribe, and distribute minutes of meetings.
• Greet visitors and assess access to specific individuals.
• Perform general office duties such as ordering supplies and maintaining records management database systems.
• Liaise with internal staff at all levels to facilitate smooth and timely communication.
• Handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion.

Required Skills and Qualifications
• A minimum of 5 years of experience as an Executive Secretary or similar role supporting senior-level management.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
• Strong organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with impeccable multi-tasking abilities.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative management style.
• High level of discretion and ethical approach to confidentiality.
• Fluent in both English and German.

The company offers a competitive salary package, professional growth opportunities, and a dynamic work environment. This role is an excellent opportunity for an experienced and dedicated executive assistant to contribute to the success of a prominent organization.

response.title: Legal Secretary - Frankfurt Am Main Area
response.description:
Job summary

A renowned law firm in the Frankfurt Am Main area is seeking a highly organized and efficient Legal Secretary to join their dynamic team. This role requires a candidate who is adept at providing comprehensive support to attorneys by performing a broad range of secretarial, administrative, and clerical tasks.

Key responsibilities include:
• Preparing legal documentation and correspondence including drafting, proofreading and editing documents to ensure accuracy.
• Managing calendars and appointments for attorneys, coordinating meetings, and ensuring that all necessary materials and information are prepared and available.
• Handling communication with clients, witnesses, and court officials, as well as maintaining confidential client information.
• Utilizing legal management software to track cases and document actions.
• Assisting with legal research, fact-checking, and compiling data as required.

Requirements:
• Proven experience as a legal secretary or similar administrative role in a law office.
• Familiarity with legal procedures and protocols, and court system operations.
• Proficiency in MS Office, and the ability to quickly learn new software and systems.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and English.
• Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively.

The firm offers a supportive work environment with opportunities for professional development. Candidates interested in applying should demonstrate a strong commitment to their work, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and professionalism.

response.title: School Secretary - Frankfurt am Main Area
response.description:
Job summary

A local school in the Frankfurt am Main area is seeking a dedicated and organized School Secretary to join their administrative team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in the smooth operation of the school's daily functions and serve as a key point of contact for students, parents, teachers, and administrators.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
• Managing the reception area and serving as a first point of contact for visitors and callers, ensuring a warm and professional greeting.
• Handling a variety of administrative tasks, including scheduling appointments, maintaining school records, and managing correspondence.
• Assisting with the organization of school events and activities, and providing support to the teaching staff as needed.
• Coordinating meetings, preparing agendas, and taking minutes during staff meetings and other school-related gatherings.
• Managing student information and attendance records, ensuring confidentiality and integrity of the data.

The ideal candidate will have: 
• Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
• Excellent communication abilities with proficiency in both German and English.
• A welcoming and positive demeanor with the ability to foster a friendly and professional school environment.
• Proficiency in office software and familiarity with administrative procedures.
• Previous experience in an educational or secretarial role would be beneficial.

Education and qualifications: 
• A minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent is required. Additional certification in office administration or relevant field is an advantage.

This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who is passionate about education and enjoys working in a dynamic school setting. If you are committed to making a difference in the lives of students and eager to contribute to a thriving school community, we encourage you to apply.

response.title: Medical Secretary - Frankfurt Clinic
response.description:
Job summary

Frankfurt Clinic is seeking an experienced Medical Secretary to join our healthcare team. The successful candidate will provide administrative support to our medical staff, ensuring that all clerical functions are carried out efficiently and effectively in support of patient care. Our clinic is dedicated to providing exceptional service, and the Medical Secretary will be an integral part of our operations. This position is ideal for a meticulously organized individual with a strong background in medical transcription, scheduling, and healthcare administration.

Job responsibilities
• Manage patient appointments, including scheduling, rescheduling, and handling cancellations; ensuring a smooth workflow and minimizing wait times.
• Transcribe medical documents from dictation, prepare correspondence, and maintain patient records with the utmost confidentiality and accuracy.
• Facilitate communication between patients, medical staff, and external parties, such as insurance companies and other healthcare providers.
• Assist with billing processes, including insurance claims and tracking patient payments.
• Order and manage office supplies, ensuring that our healthcare professionals have the necessary materials for their work.
• Participate in staff meetings and contribute to the continuous improvement of clinic procedures.

Qualifications
• Proven experience as a Medical Secretary or similar administrative role in a healthcare environment.
• Excellent command of medical terminology and a good understanding of healthcare operations.
• Proficiency in office software, including EMR (Electronic Medical Records) systems.
• Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
• Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, in English and preferably also in German.
• Empathetic and professional demeanor, with a focus on patient-centered care.

The right candidate will be offered a competitive salary package, including benefits and opportunities for professional development. If you are looking to advance your career as a Medical Secretary and make a positive impact on patient experiences, Frankfurt Clinic is the place for you.

response.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Applications
response.description:
Job Overview

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic team of web developers. The ideal candidate will bring a depth of experience in creating and maintaining web applications with a focus on scalability, performance, and user experience. You will be collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and deliver new features and enhancements for our web presence.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop high-quality, maintainable code for our web applications, including e-commerce platforms, customer portals, and internal tools.
• Lead the design and implementation of software systems with a keen eye for system integration and robust architecture.
• Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and other engineers to ideate creative solutions to meet user needs.
• Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability, ensuring compatibility across various browsers and devices.
• Participate in code reviews, mentoring junior developers, and driving engineering best practices within the team.
• Continuously research, evaluate, and apply new technologies to maximize development efficiency.
• Tackle complex problems with a strategic mindset and articulate technical challenges and solutions to non-technical team members.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a Software Engineer with a focus on web technologies.
• Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g., HTML/CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery).
• Familiarity with server-side languages (e.g., Python, Ruby, Java, PHP) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Angular, React, Node.js).
• Experience with responsive and adaptive design along with understanding of SEO principles.
• Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical mindset, and attention to detail.

The position offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and a collaborative work environment. If you are driven to create amazing user experiences and thrive in a fast-paced setting, we would love to get to know you.

response.title: Project Manager - Frankfurt at BuildRight Construction
response.description:
Job summary

Join our team at BuildRight Construction as a Project Manager in our Frankfurt office, where you will lead construction projects from conception to completion. You will work closely with clients, architects, engineers, and subcontractors to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest standards of quality.

As Project Manager, you will have the opportunity to manage diverse building projects, including commercial real estate, residential developments, and infrastructure upgrades. Our company values innovative solutions and sustainable practices, and we're looking for an individual who can help us maintain our reputation as industry leaders.

Job responsibilities
• Develop and track project plans, budgets, and schedules, ensuring all milestones are met.
• Coordinate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business objectives.
• Provide leadership and support to project team members, fostering a collaborative work environment.
• Manage contracts, permits, and compliance with all safety and construction regulations.
• Communicate effectively with all stakeholders, reporting regularly on project status and addressing any issues that arise.
• Identify and mitigate project risks and implement improvements to maximize efficiency.
• Oversee the quality management of construction projects to ensure standards are maintained and outcomes meet expectations.
• Engage in continuous improvement efforts to enhance project management methodologies and tools.

The ideal candidate will have a degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field, with substantial experience managing large-scale construction projects. PMP certification is preferable. Strong leadership abilities, excellent communication skills, and proficiency in project management software are essential for this role.

We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for career advancement. If you are passionate about building excellence and have a track record of success in project management, we'd love to hear from you.

response.title: Executive Secretary at Helix GmbH - Frankfurt
response.description:
Job Overview

Helix GmbH is seeking a skilled and organized Executive Secretary to support senior executives in our Frankfurt office. The Executive Secretary will be responsible for a variety of administrative and clerical tasks to ensure efficient operation of the office. This role includes managing information flow in a timely and accurate manner, making travel arrangements, organizing meetings, and providing support to our executives as needed.

Key Responsibilities
• Manage the daily/weekly/monthly agenda and arrange new meetings and appointments for the executives.
• Prepare and disseminate correspondence, memos, and forms.
• File and update contact information of employees, customers, suppliers, and external partners.
• Support and facilitate the completion of regular reports.
• Develop and maintain a filing system.

Qualifications and Skills
• Proven experience as an executive secretary or similar administrative role.
• Proficient in MS Office and “back-office” software (e.g., ERP).
• In-depth knowledge of office management and basic accounting procedures as well as technical vocabulary of relevant industry.
• Familiarity with basic research methods and reporting techniques.
• Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
• Outstanding communication and negotiation abilities.
• Integrity and confidentiality.
• Degree in business administration or relative field preferred.

Helix GmbH is dedicated to promoting diversity in the workplace and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We look forward to receiving your application.

response.description:
Job summary

Global Tech Ltd is seeking a dedicated and experienced Senior Secretary to join our team in Frankfurt. As a pivotal member of the administrative department, you will provide high-level support to our executive staff, ensuring smooth operations within our corporate office.

Responsibilities:

If you have the required qualifications and are looking to advance your career in an innovative global company, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Global Tech Ltd.

response.title: Marketing Data Analyst - Entry Level (m/f/d) - Frankfurt
response.description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an enthusiastic Marketing Data Analyst to join our vibrant team in Frankfurt. This entry-level position is ideal for someone who is passionate about the intersection of marketing and data, and is keen to grow their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:
• Analyze marketing metrics to identify cause-effect relationships between marketing actions and financial outcomes to increase profitability.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to design and implement analytics systems that collect and process marketing data effectively.
• Utilize BI tools, analytics software, and statistical methods to collect and analyze data, and to generate useful business reports.
• Work with cross-functional teams to establish growth strategies to support marketing team's efforts.
• Evaluate marketing campaigns' performance and propose new strategies based on data-driven insights.
• Assist in developing and maintaining databases, data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
• Conduct market research as required to understand trends and competitive landscapes.

Job Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Economics, Statistics, or relevant field.
• Strong analytical skills with an ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Proficiency in Excel, SQL, and other analytics and visualization tools.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team, handle multiple projects, and meet deadlines.

Our work environment is supportive and encourages the professional and personal growth of each team member. If you're driven by data and want to make a tangible impact in your marketing career, we would love to hear from you.

response.title: Human Resources Specialist (m/f/d) - Frankfurt
response.description:
Job Summary

A leading international company is seeking an experienced HR Specialist to join their Human Resources team in Frankfurt. As a Human Resources Specialist, you will be responsible for implementing and managing HR functions including recruitment, staff development, and employee relations. This position offers an excellent opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with a strong emphasis on employee engagement and professional growth.

Key Responsibilities

Qualifications

• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively at all levels of the organization.
• Proficient in using HR information systems and familiar with digital transformation in HR.

This is a full-time position that promises a stimulating work environment and excellent opportunities for career advancement. If you are a proactive, forward-thinking HR professional looking for an exciting new challenge, we encourage you to apply.

response.title: Company Secretary at ABC Company - Frankfurt
response.description:
We are seeking a dedicated and highly competent Company Secretary to join our team at ABC Company, based in Frankfurt. This key role will involve ensuring that the company complies with legal and statutory requirements, as well as maintaining high standards of corporate governance. The individual will act as a point of communication between the board of directors and company shareholders, reporting in a timely and accurate manner on company procedures and developments.

Responsibilities:
- Organizing and preparing agendas for board meetings, committees, and annual general meetings (AGMs).
- Taking minutes, drafting resolutions, and lodging required forms and annual returns with Companies House.
- Advising on legal, governance, accounting, and tax implications of proposed policies.
- Monitoring changes in relevant legislation and the regulatory environment, and taking appropriate action.
- Liaising with external regulators and advisers, such as lawyers and auditors.
- Developing and overseeing the systems that ensure the company complies with all applicable codes, as well as its legal and statutory requirements.

Requirements:
- Proven experience in a company secretary role or a similar administrative position.
- Good understanding of company law and corporate governance principles.
- Strong administration skills and a methodical approach to work.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
- A professional certification in company secretarial work is preferred.

ABC Company offers a challenging and dynamic work environment. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified individuals to apply. This is an opportunity to join a highly professional team in a role that is crucial to the company’s decision-making process and to contribute to the corporate integrity of ABC Company.

As a Corporate Secretary for MNO Corporation based in Frankfurt, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the company's compliance with legal and statutory requirements and implementing corporate governance practices.
